text:
Organizations use Amazon EC2 to process their
highly sensitive data, which can be protected

at rest and in transit using encryption -- but
what happens when it needs to be decrypted
for processing?

Customers isolate their data by setting up
separate Virtual Private Clouds, removing

unnecessary software, restricting user access,
limiting connectivity, and more.
However, doing this can be complex.

AWS Nitro Enclaves simplifies it, enabling
you to easily create fully isolated compute

environments, to process your highly sensitive
data.

Enclaves are separate virtual machines, hardened,
and highly constrained.

They have no persistent storage, no interactive
access, and no external networking.

Nitro Enclaves uses the Nitro Hypervisor to
further isolate the CPU and memory of the

enclave from users, applications, and libraries
on the parent instance.

With capabilities like Cryptographic Attestation,
you can trust and verify your enclave s identity

and that only authorized code is running in
it.

AWS Key Management Service can read and verify
attestation documents sent from the enclave,

so that only your Enclave can access sensitive
material.
Nitro Enclaves is easy to use and flexible.

They can be created with varying amounts of
compute resources and are compatible with
any programming language and framework.

AWS Nitro Enclaves is the simple and effective
choice for isolating your highly sensitive
data for processing.
Get started today.
